H0.text: Tadpole development can be directed by the nucleus from a differentiated frog cell.

H1.text: Embryo development can be directed by the nucleus from a differentiated frog cell.

H2.text: Fetus is directed to develop by the nucleus from a differentiated frog cell.

H3.text: The ovary is the tissue whose development can be directed by the nucleus from a differentiated frog cell.

A4.text: The ovum, now containing the somatic cell's nucleus, is stimulated with a shock and will begin to divide. The egg is now viable and capable of producing an adult organism containing all necessary genetic information from just one parent.

A5.text: Development will ensue normally and after many mitotic divisions, the single cell forms a blastocyst (an early stage embryo with about 100 cells) with an identical genome to the original organism (i.e. a clone).
